result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Scott F Falkner was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. Enclosed is an assessment information sheet and a referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.

Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

timeConds.notes: Court grants work release and good time. Must report to jail today, 8/26/22. Court grants 2 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott F Falkner

records.addlTxt:
10:15 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Scott F Falkner appeared by video, Attorney Michael J Steuer appeared by video for Scott F Falkner for today only.  Qualifies for public defender.  Court resets before Judge Bitney.  Address confirmed and phone number updated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, may only possess alcohol for employment purposes.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold except for employment related purposes only.  
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
